subject: thoughts to live by
verse: But the Lord's plans stand firm forever; his intentions can never be shaken. (Psalm 33:11)
reflection: "The Lord's plans stand firm forever. " Are you frustrated by the inconsistencies you see in others or even yourself? God is completely trustworthy-His intentions never change. There is a promise that whatever is good and perfect comes to us from the Creator who never changes (James 1:17). When you wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember that God is completely consistent. Let Him counsel you. .
prayer: Dear Lord I need Your presence every passing hour; Only by Your grace can the Tempter's power be foiled. No one but You can guide me down the path of righteousness, Through every trial be my guide. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 33:11 

But the Lord's plans stand firm forever; his intentions can never be shaken.




Today's Thoughts:

"The Lord's plans stand firm forever." Are you frustrated by the
inconsistencies

you see in others or even yourself? God is completely trustworthy-His
intensions 

never change. There is a promise that whatever is good and perfect comes to
us from

the Creator who never changes (James 1:17).



When you wonder if there is anyone you can trust, remember that God is
completely

consistent. Let Him counsel you. 



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord I need Your presence every passing hour;

Only by Your grace can the Tempter's power be foiled.

No one but You can guide me down the path of 

righteousness, Through every trial be my guide. .Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: In my desperation I prayed, and the Lord listened; he saved me from all my troubles. For the angel of the Lord is a guard; he surrounds and defends all who fear him. Taste and see that the Lord is good. Oh, the joys of those who take refuge in him! (Psalm 34:6-8)
reflection: "Taste and see, " does not mean, "check out God's credentials. " Instead, it is an invitation; "Try this; I know you will like it. " When we take that first step of obedience in following God, we cannot help discovering That He is good and kind-When we begin the Christian life, our knowledge of God is partial and incomplete-but as we trust in Him each day, we will experience how good He is-He will supply our needs. .
prayer: Dear Lord as I begin another day with You, search my heart-and-purify my affections so that I may love only those things that are pleasing to You-andthat I will put You first in all things. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 34:6-8 

In my desperation I prayed, and the Lord listened; he saved me from all my
troubles.

For the angel of the Lord is a guard; he surrounds and defends all who fear
him. 
Taste and see that the Lord is good. Oh, the joys of those who take refuge
in him!



Today's Thoughts: 

"Taste and see," does not mean, "check out God's credentials." Instead, it
is an

invitation; "Try this; I know you will like it."



When we take that first step of obedience in following God, we cannot help
discovering

That He is good and kind-When we begin the Christian life, our knowledge of
God is

partial and incomplete-but as we trust in Him each day, we will experience
how good

He is-He will supply our needs. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord as I begin another day with You, search my heart-and-purify my

affections so that I may love only those things that are pleasing to
You-andthat I will put You first in all things. .Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Fools are destroyed by their own complacency. But all who listen to me will live in peace, untroubled by fear of harm." (Proverbs 1:32b-33)
reflection: Many proverbs point out that the "bitter fruit of living their own way" will be the consequences people will experience in this life. We are faced with two choices-either choosing God's wisdom or persisting in rebellious independence, deciding to go it alone. Choosing the latter will create problems for people that will destroy them. Don't ignore God's advice-even if-it is painful for the present. It will keep you from greater pain in the future. .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me overcome the temptations I will meet today. Strengthen my faith that I might have victory over the devil that in so doing it would be to Your glory. Keep me mindful of the sufficiency of Your grace, and let Your strength be made perfect In my weakness. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Prov. 1:32b-33

"Fools are destroyed by their own complacency.

But all who listen to me will live in peace, untroubled by fear of harm."



Today's Thoughts:

Many proverbs point out that the "bitter fruit of living their own way"

will be the consequences people will experience in this life. We are faced 

with two choices-either choosing God's wisdom or persisting in rebellious 

independence, deciding to go it alone.



Choosing the latter will create problems for people that will destroy them.

Don't ignore God's advice-even if-it is painful for the present. It will

keep you from greater pain in the future. .

Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord, help me overcome the temptations I will meet today.

Strengthen my faith that I might have victory over the devil that

in so doing it would be to Your glory. Keep me mindful of the

sufficiency of Your grace, and let Your strength be made perfect

In my weakness. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I have been given all authority in heaven and on earth. (Matthew 28:18)
reflection: Just think of what the disciples had learned to know the power of Christ Jesus here on earth. And yet that was just a little thing as compared with the greater works that He was now to do in and through themHe has the power to work even in the feeblest of His servants with the strength of the Almighty God. He has power even to use their apparent weakness to carry out His purposes. He has the power over every enemy and every human heart, over every difficulty and danger. But let us remember that this power is never meant to be experienced as if it were our own. .
prayer: Dear Lord, Although I am unable to carry out Your purposes, I trust in Your power over every enemy, and over every danger and difficulty. Amen.

Jesus

here on earth. And yet that was just a little thing as compared with the
greater 

works that He was now to do in and through themHe has the power to work even in the feeblest of His servants with the
strength

of the Almighty God. He has power even to use their apparent weakness to

But let us remember that this power is never meant to be experienced as if

were our own. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Certainly I am with thee. (Exodus 3:12)
reflection: Here as well as elsewhere in the spiritual life, everything depends upon faith, accepting Christ's Word as a divine reality and trusting the Holy Spirit to make it true to us from moment to moment. When Christ says "always" in the (Gr. It means: "All the days. "). He means to give us the assurance that there is not to be a day in our life in which that blessed presence is not to be with us, and that "All the days" implies "All the day. " There need not be a moment in which that presence cannot be our experience. It does not depend upon what we do-but upon what He undertakes to do. Our attitude must be that of a quiet, restful faith, of a humble, lowly dependence in accordance with the word, "Rest in the Lord and wait patiently for Him, " The writer of Psalm 139 speaks of God's omnipresence as something beyond his comprehension. "Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, it is high, I cannot attain it. "
prayer: Thank You, Lord Jesus, for Your words, "Lo, I am, with you always. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Ex. 3:12

"Certainly I am with thee."



Today's Thoughts:

Here as well as elsewhere in the spiritual life, everything depends upon
faith, accepting Christ's

Word as a divine reality and trusting the Holy Spirit to make it true to us
from moment to moment.



When Christ says "always" in the (Gr. It means: "All the days."). He means
to give us the assurance

that there is not to be a day in our life in which that blessed presence is
not to be with us, and that

"All the days" implies "All the day." There need not be a moment in which
that presence cannot be

our experience. .



It does not depend upon what we do-but upon what He undertakes to do. Our
attitude must be that 

of a quiet, restful faith, of a humble, lowly dependence in accordance with
the word, "Rest in the 

Lord and wait patiently for Him," 



The writer of Ps. 139 speaks of God's omnipresence as something beyond his
comprehension.

"Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, it is high, I cannot attain it."



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Thank You, Lord Jesus, for Your words, "Lo, I am, with you always. Amen.




Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "This is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the World." (John 4:42)
reflection: Yes it is Jesus Christ who saves His people from their sins, who rules over a people willing in the day of His power and proves in them that He enables them to say"I delight to do Thy will, O my God, " who says, "Lo I am with you always. " The abiding presence of the Savior from sin is promised to all who have accepted Him in the fullness of His redeeming power and who preach by their lives as well as by their words what a wonderful Savior He is. .
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus, You are truly the Savior of the world and the Redeemer of all. We have heard Your command to go into all the world and preach the Gospel and to obey all that You have commanded-forgive me where I have failed. Amen
original_content:
Today's Verse: Jn. 4:42

"This is indeed the Christ, the Savior of the World."



Today's Thoughts:

Yes it is Jesus Christ who saves His people from their sins, who rules over
a people

willing in the day of His power and proves in them that He enables them to
say"I delight to do Thy will, O my God," who says, "Lo I am with you always."



The abiding presence of the Savior from sin is promised to all who have
accepted Him

in the fullness of His redeeming power and who preach by their lives as well
as by their words

what a wonderful Savior He is. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord Jesus, You are truly the Savior of the world and the Redeemer of
all.

We have heard Your command to go into all the world and preach the Gospel

and to obey all that You have commanded-forgive me where I have failed. .
Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: As for me, may I never boast about anything except the cross of our Lord Jesus Christ. Because of that cross, my interest in this world has been crucified, and the world's interest in me has also died. (Galatians 6:14)
reflection: I believe the reason we do not glory in the Cross as we should-is that we do not expect and enjoy His abiding presence as we should. Nor do we glory in the Cross by which we were crucified to the world. Remember that Scriptures tell us that we were crucified with Christ; our "old man was Crucified with Him", they that are Christ's have crucified the flesh with its affections and lusts-and yet how little we have learned that the world has been crucified to us and that we are free from its power. Yes how little we have learned. As those who are crucified with Christ, to deny ourselves, to have the mind that was in Christ when He emptied Himself and took the form of a servant and humbled Himself and became obedient even to the death of the Cross. .
prayer: Dear Lord Jesus-Let us learn the lesson, it is You the crucified Christ, Who comes to walk with us every day, and in whose power we too are to live the life that can say: "I have been crucified with Christ" "Christ lives in me. " Amen.
original_content:

Jesus Christ. Because of 

that cross, my interest in this world has been crucified, and the world's
interest in me has also died. 



Today's Thoughts:

I believe the reason we do not glory in the Cross as we should-is that we do
not expect

and enjoy His abiding presence as we should. Nor do we glory in the Cross by
which we

were crucified to the world.



Remember that Scriptures tell us that we were crucified with Christ; our
"old man was 

Crucified with Him", they that are Christ's have crucified the flesh with
its affections and 

lusts-and yet how little we have learned that the world has been crucified

we are free from its power. .



Yes how little we have learned. As those who are crucified with Christ, to

to have the mind that was in Christ when He emptied Himself and took the
form of a

servant and humbled Himself and became obedient even to the death of the
Cross. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord Jesus-Let us learn the lesson, it is You the crucified Christ,

Who comes to walk with us every day, and in whose power we too are

to live the life that can say: "I have been crucified with Christ"

"Christ lives in me." Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: For the Lamb at the center of the throne will be their shepherd; 'he will lead them to springs of living water.' And God will wipe every tear from their eyes. (Revelation 7:17)
reflection: In verses 1-8 we see the believers receiving a seal to protect them through a time ofGreat tribulation and sufferingIn verses 9-17 we see the believers finally with God in heaven. All who have been faithful Through the ages they are singing before God's throne. Their tribulations and sorrows are over: No more tears for sin, for all sins are forgivenNo more tears for suffering, for all suffering is overNo more tears for death, for all believers have been resurrected to die no more. So let us stay on the path of the Lord-and follow Him. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father I believe that Christ is the embodiment of YouThe everlasting God-and of Your love-and He is my Shepherd and Keeper. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Rev. 7:17; 14:4

For the Lamb on the throne will be their Shepherd. He will lead them to
springs of life-giving water. 

And God will wipe every tear from their eyes." These are those which follow
the Lamb wherever he goes. 



Today's Thoughts:

In verses 1-8 we see the believers receiving a seal to protect them through
a time ofGreat tribulation and sufferingIn verses 9-17 we see the believers finally with God in heaven. All who have
been faithful

Through the ages they are singing before God's throne. Their tribulations
and sorrows are over:

No more tears for sin, for all sins are forgivenNo more tears for suffering, for all suffering is overNo more tears for death, for all believers have been resurrected to die no
more. .



So let us stay on the path of the Lord-and follow Him. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father I believe that Christ is the embodiment of YouThe everlasting God-and of Your love-and He is my Shepherd and

Keeper. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Sanctified by God the Father. (Jude 1:1). Sanctified in Christ Jesus.(Corinthians 1:2) Through sanctification of the Spirit. (Peter 1:2)
reflection: Mark the union of the Three Divine Persons in all their gracious acts. How unwisely do those believers talk who make preferences in the Persons of the Trinity; who think of Jesus as if He were the embodiment of everything lovely and gracious, while the Father they regard as severely just, but destitute of kindness. Equally wrong are those who magnify the decree of the Father, and the atonement of the Son, so as to depreciate the work of the Spirit. In deeds of grace none of the Persons of the Trinity act apart from the rest. They are as united in their deeds as in their essence. In their love towards the chosen they are one, and in the actions which flow from that great central source they are still undivided. Specially notice this in the matter of sanctification. While we may without mistake speak of sanctification as the work of the Spirit, yet we must take heed that we do not view it as if the Father and the Son had no part in it. It is correct to speak of sanctification asthe work of the Father, of the Son, and of the Spirit. Still doth Jehovah say, Let us make man in our own image after our likeness, and thus we are his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God has before ordained that we should walk in them.  See the value which God sets upon real holiness, since the Three Persons in the Trinity are represented as co-working to produce a Church without spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing. And you, believer, as the follower of Christ, must also set a high value on holiness-upon purity of life and godliness of conversation. Value the blood of Christ as the foundation of your hope, but never speak disparagingly of the work of the Spirit which is your meekness for the inheritance of the saints in light. This day let us so live as to manifest the work of the Triune God in us.
prayer: Dear God, Father, Son, and Holy Spirit grant your sanctifying presence. For Jesus sake forgive all my sins and shortcomings, especially if I have offended some soul weak in faith or if I have neglected the opportunity to share the Good News with someone. Grant me Your Spirits power so that each day I may grow in faith and in the knowledge of my Savior. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: 

"Sanctified by God the Father." Jude 1:1
<http://www.crossbooks.com/verse.asp?ref=Jude+1%3A1> 

"Sanctified in Christ Jesus." 1Corinthians 1:2
<http://www.crossbooks.com/verse.asp?ref=1Co+1%3A2> 

"Through sanctification of the Spirit." 1Peter 1:2
<http://www.crossbooks.com/verse.asp?ref=1Pe+1%3A2> 

Mark the union of the Three Divine Persons in all their gracious acts. 

How unwisely do those believers talk who make preferences in the Persons of
the Trinity; 

who think of Jesus as if He were the embodiment of everything lovely and
gracious, 

while the Father they regard as severely just, but destitute of kindness. 



Equally wrong are those who magnify the decree of the Father, and the
atonement of the Son, so as to depreciate the work of the Spirit. 

In deeds of grace none of the Persons of the Trinity act apart from the
rest. They are as united in their deeds as in their essence. 

In their love towards the chosen they are one, and in the actions which flow
from that great central source they are still undivided. 

Specially notice this in the matter of sanctification. While we may without
mistake speak of sanctification as the work of the Spirit, 

yet we must take heed that we do not view it as if the Father and the Son
had no part in it. It is correct to speak of sanctification asthe work of the Father, of the Son, and of the Spirit. Still doth Jehovah
say, "Let us make man in our own image after our likeness," and thus we are 

"his workmanship, created in Christ Jesus unto good works, which God has
before ordained that we should walk in them." 



See the value which God sets upon real holiness, since the Three Persons in
the Trinity are represented as co-working to produce a Church without 

"spot, or wrinkle, or any such thing." And you, believer, as the follower of
Christ, must also set a high value on holiness-upon purity of life and 

godliness of conversation. Value the blood of Christ as the foundation of
your hope, but never speak disparagingly of the work of the Spirit which

is your meekness for the inheritance of the saints in light. This day let us
so live as to manifest the work of the Triune God in us.



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear God, Father, Son, and Holy Spirit grant your sanctifying presence.

For Jesus sake forgive all my sins and shortcomings, especially if I have

offended some soul weak in faith or if I have neglected the opportunity

to share the Good News with someone. Grant me Your Spirits power 

so that each day I may grow in faith and in the knowledge of my Savior. .
Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Those who accept my commandments and obey them are the ones who love me. And because they love me, my Father will love them. And I will love them and reveal myself to each of them." (John 14:21)
reflection: I think we have all wished at one time or another that we could know the future, so we could prepare for it. God has chosen not to give us this knowledge. He alone knows what will happen, but He tells us all we need to know to prepare for the future. When we live by His standards He will not leave us-He will come to us-He will be with us-and He will show Himself to us. God knows what will happen, and because He will be with us through it all, we need not fear. We don't have to know the future to have faith in God, BUT we need to have faith in Him to feel secure about the future. Jesus said that His followers show their love for Him by obeying Him. Love is more that lovely words-it is commitment and conduct. If you love Christ, then prove it by obeying what He says in His Word. .
prayer: Dear Lord I will keep Your promise by the power of Your Holy Spirit. I ask You just now to come into my heart and reveal Yourself to me. Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The Holy Spirit-he will teach you everything and will remind you of everything I have told you. (John 14:26)
reflection: As we see here Jesus promised His disciple that He would send the Holy Spirit and He would help them remember what He had been teaching them. Actually this ensures the validity of the New Testament. The Disciples were eyewitnesses of Jesus' life and teachings, and the Holy Spirit helped them remember without taking away their individual perspectives. We can be confident that the Gospels are accurate records of what Jesus taught and did see. The Holy Spirit can teach us in the same way-As we study the Bible, we can trust Him to plant truth into our mind-convince us of God's will-and remind us when we stray from it.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank You for the promise of the Holy Spirit to guide and direct my life-I pray that You would help me to be sensitive and obedient to this promise. Amen
original_content:

and He would help them remember what He had been teaching them. Actually

of Jesus' life and teachings, and the Holy Spirit helped them remember

and did see. The Holy Spirit can teach us in the same way-As we study the

me to be sensitive and obedient to this promise. .Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "I am the light of the world. If you follow me, you won't have to walk in darkness, because you will have the light that leads to life." (John 8:12))
reflection: Jesus called Himself the "Light of the World. " As such He represented God's presenceprotection-and guidance. And as such He is the "Light of the World. " Jesus gives us an option -"If you follow me, " From this option, a question arises which seems strange to Christiansbut it has been asked-"What does it mean to follow Jesus?" WELLAs a soldier follows his captain, so we should follow Christ, our commander. As a slave follows his master, so we should follow Christ, or Lord. As we follow the advice of a trusted counselor, so we should follow Jesus' commands to us in Scripture. As we follow the laws of our nation, so we should follow the laws of the Kingdom of Heaven. Let us be found faithful-in following the "Light that leads to life-eternal life. .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to live this day walking in Your light. Let His Cross be my glory and His favor my crown. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Jn. 8:12

"I am the light of the world. If you follow me, you won't have to walk in
darkness, 

because you will have the light that leads to life." 



Today's Thoughts: 

Jesus called Himself the "Light of the World." As such He represented God's
presenceprotection-and guidance. And as such He is the "Light of the World."



Jesus gives us an option-"If you follow me," From this option, a question
arises which seems strange to Christiansbut it has been asked-"What does it mean to follow Jesus?" WELLAs a soldier follows his captain, so we should follow Christ, our commander.

As a slave follows his master, so we should follow Christ, or Lord.

As we follow the advice of a trusted counselor, so we should follow Jesus'
commands to us in Scripture.

As we follow the laws of our nation, so we should follow the laws of the
Kingdom of Heaven.



Let us be found faithful-in following the "Light that leads to life-eternal
life. .



Today's Suggested Prayer:

Dear Lord, help me to live this day walking in Your light.

Let His Cross be my glory and His favor my crown. Amen.





Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 34 Jesus replied, "I tell you the truth, everyone who sins is a slave of sin. 35 A slave is not a permanent member of the family, but a son is part of the family forever (John 8:34-35)
reflection: Jesus had no time for sin-WHY? Because sin has a way of enslaving usControlling us-dominating us-and dictating our actions-SO what is the remedy? Well Jesus can free you from this slavery that keeps you from becoming the person God has created you to be. If sin is restraining, mastering, or enslaving you-Jesus can break its power over your life.
prayer: Dear Lord, I lift my heart up to You today sincerely grateful for the opportunities of another day. Guide and direct me today so all that I do would be pleasing to You. Keep me mindful that all Depends on my possessing your abundant grace and blessing. Amen.

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: My gracious favor is all you need-My power works best in your weakness. (2 Corinthians 12:9)
reflection: Although God did not remove Paul's affliction, He promised to demonstrate His power in Paul. The fact that God's power is displayed in our weakness should give us courage and hopeAs we recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our effectiveness rather than our own energy, effort, or talent. If we swallow our pride we would realize that our limitation not only help us develop Christian character but also deepen our worship, because in admitting our weaknesses, we affirm God's strength. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize my limitations, and the courage to admit that in my own strength I am a weak and hope less human being, but I can do all thing by Your power. Be Thou My Strength Today. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: 2 Cor. 12:9 (NLT)

"My gracious favor is all you need-My power works best in your weakness.



Today's Thoughts:

Although God did not remove Paul's affliction, He promised to demonstrate

His power in Paul. The fact that God's power is displayed in our weakness

should give us courage and hopeAs we recognize our limitations, we will depend more on God for our
effectiveness

rather than our own energy, effort, or talent. If we swallow our pride we
would realize

that our limitation not only help us develop Christian character but also
deepen our 

worship, because in admitting our weaknesses, we affirm God's strength. .



Today's Suggested Prayer:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to recognize my limitations, and the courage
to admit 

that in my own strength I am a weak and hope less human being, but I can do
all thing

by Your power. Be Thou My Strength Today. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: when we brought you the Good News, it was not only with words but also with power, for the Holy Spirit gave you full assurance that what we said was true. And you know of our concern for you from the way we lived when we were with you (1 Thessalonians 1:5)
reflection: When we tell other people about the Good News we have to depend upon the Holy Spirit to open their eyes and convince them that they need salvation God's powerIt is not our cleverness or persuasion-that changes peopleWithout the work of the Holy Spirit, our words are meaningless. The Holy Spirit not only convicts people of sin but also assures them of the truth of the Good News. The Thessalonians could see what Paul, Silas, and Timothy were preaching was true because these men lived it. Does your life confirm or contradict what you say you believe. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my witness for you would not cause people to doubt Your Word because of any of my speech or actions. Help me to be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance. Amen
original_content:

when we brought you the Good News, it was not only with words but also with

for the Holy Spirit gave you full assurance that what we said was true.

Spirit

not only convicts people of sin but also assures them of the truth of the

because these men lived it. Does your life confirm or contradict what you

to doubt Your Word because of any of my speech or actions. Help me to be

sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance. Amen

Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"If you love me, obey My commandments." John 14:15

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: You also should consider yourselves to be dead to the power of sin and alive to God through Christ Jesus. (Romans 6:11)
reflection: "Consider yourself dead to sin" means that we should regard our sinful nature as dead and unresponsive to sin. Because of our union and identification with Christ we no longer want to pursue our old plans-desires-and goals. Now we want to live for the glory of God. As we start our "new" life in Christ, the Holy Spirit will help us to become all that Christ wants us to be. .
prayer: Dear Lord, help me to become all that You want me to be. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Romans 6:11 (NLT)

You also should consider yourselves to be dead to the power of sin and 

alive to God through Christ Jesus. 



Today's Thoughts:

"Consider yourself dead to sin" means that we should regard our sinful
nature

as dead and unresponsive to sin. Because of our union and identification
with 

Christ we no longer want to pursue our old plans-desires-and goals.

Now we want to live for the glory of God. .



As we start our "new" life in Christ, the Holy Spirit will help us to become
all 

that Christ wants us to be. .



Today's Suggested Prayer:

Dear Lord, help me to become all that You want me to be. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 14 So the trouble is not with the law, for it is spiritual and good. The trouble is with me, for I am all too human, a slave to sin. 15 I don't really understand myself, for I want to do what is right, but I don't do it. Instead, I do what I hate. 16 But if I know that what I am doing is wrong, this shows that I agree that the law is good.
reflection: This is more than the cry from one desperate person, it describes the experience of all Christians struggling against sin and trying to please God by keeping His laws and rules without the Spirit's help. We must never underestimate the power of sin and attempt to fight it in our own strength. Satin is a crafty tempter, and we have an amazing ability to make excusesInstead of trying to overcome sin with our own human willpower, we must take hold of God's provision for victory over sin: the Holy Spirit who lives within us and gives us power. AND when we fall, He lovingly reaches out to help us up. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the privilege of speaking to You in prayer. It is good to know that even though You are the Creator of all things in heaven and earth You still hear my prayers. Continue to give me childlike faith that I may never doubt that You will always hear my prayer. Give me the patients to accept Your answers for You know what is best for me. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Romans 7:14-16 (NLT)

14 So the trouble is not with the law, for it is spiritual and good. The
trouble is with me, for I am all too human, a slave to sin.

don't do it. Instead, I do what I hate.

16 But if I know that what I am doing is wrong, this shows that I agree that
the law is good. 



Today's Thoughts:

This is more than the cry from one desperate person, it describes the
experience of all Christians

struggling against sin and trying to please God by keeping His laws and
rules without the Spirit's

help. We must never underestimate the power of sin and attempt to fight it
in our own strength.

Satin is a crafty tempter, and we have an amazing ability to make excusesInstead of trying to overcome sin with our own human willpower, we must take
hold of God's 

provision for victory over sin: the Holy Spirit who lives within us and

when we fall, He lovingly reaches out to help us up. .

heaven and 

earth You still hear my prayers. Continue to give me childlike faith that I
may never

doubt that You will always hear my prayer. Give me the patients to accept
Your

answers for You know what is best for me. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"He says, "Be still, and know that I am God;" Psalm 46:10

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 4 Always be full of joy in the Lord. I say it again-rejoice! 5 Let everyone see that you are considerate in all you do. Remember, the Lord is coming soon. (Phil 4:4-5)
reflection: It seems strange that a man in prison would be telling a church to rejoice. But Paul's attitude teaches us an important lesson-our inner attitudes do not have to reflect our outward circumstances. Paul was full of joy because he knew that no matter what happened to him Jesus Christ was with him. It's easy to get discouraged because of unpleasant circumstances or to take unimportant events too seriously. If you haven't been joyful lately, you may not be looking at life from the right perspective. Ultimate joy comes from Christ living inside of us. Yes He who lives within us will fulfill His final purpose for us. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my attitude would always reflect the joy that we should have because of Christ's presence within us. Give those who pray this prayer the assurance that Jesus is coming soon to take them to be with Him in the place that He has prepared. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Phil 4:4-5 (NLT)

5 Let everyone see that you are considerate in all you do. Remember, the

Today's Thoughts:

It seems strange that a man in prison would be telling a church to rejoice.
But Paul's attitude

teaches us an important lesson-our inner attitudes do not have to reflect

circumstances. Paul was full of joy because he knew that no matter what
happened to him

It's easy to get discouraged because of unpleasant circumstances or to take

events too seriously. If you haven't been joyful lately, you may not be

from the right perspective. 

Ultimate joy comes from Christ living inside of us. Yes He who lives within

fulfill His final purpose for us. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

those who pray this prayer the assurance that Jesus is coming soon

to take them to be with Him in the place that He has prepared.Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-_1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 6 Don't worry about anything; instead, pray about everything. Tell God what you need, and thank him for all he has done. 7 Then you will experience God's peace, which exceeds anything we can understand. His peace will guard your hearts and minds as you live in Christ Jesus (Phil 4:6-7)
reflection: Can you imagine never worrying about anything-in our human thinking it seems like an impossibility. We've all had worries about a job, our homes, our families, we could go on and on about things we have worried about at one time or another. But Paul's advice is that we turn our worries into prayer. SO-do you want to worry less-then pray more. Whenever you start to worry-stop and pray. If you do this Paul says-then you will experience God's peace. God's peace is different than the world's peace. True peace is not found in positive thinking, in the absence of conflict, or in good feelings. It comes from knowing that God is in control. -It also comes from knowing that our citizenship in Christ's kingdom is sure. -and that our destiny is set. -Let God's peace guard your heart against anxiety.
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me for being anxious about worldly things-help me to place my trust in You. The next time I begin to worry may Your Holy Spirit encourage me to pray more. Amen.
original_content:

more. .Amen.

"Shout for joy to the LORD, all the earth." Palsm 100-:1

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Keep putting into practice what you have learned. (Philippians 4:9)
reflection: It is not enough to hear or read the Word of God or even to know it well-we must also put it into practice. How easy it is to listen to a sermon and forget what the preacher said-How easy it is to read the Bible and not think about how we are to live differently-How easy it is to debate what a passage means and not live out that meaning. Remember Exposure to God's Word is not enough-it MUST lead to obedience.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would become more sensitive to Your Holy Spirit so that I would come to a greater obedience to Your Word, and live accordingly. Amen. Philippians 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.  Amen

not think about how we are to live differently-How easy it is to debate what

and live accordingly. .Amen.



Phil. 4:8 Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right.

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: I can do all this through him who gives me strength. (Philippians 4:13)
reflection: Can we really do everything? The power we receive in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will And to face the challenges that arise from our commitment to doing it. He does not grant us supper human ability to accomplish anything we can imagine without regards for His interests. As we contend for the faith, we will face troubles-pressures-and trials-as they come as Christ to strengthen you. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, grant me the strength to face the challenges of Today-Grant me the grace that some soul may learn the way of life From me, that together may rejoice with You in all eternity. Help me To witness among my relatives and friends. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Philippians 4:13 (NLT)

13 For I can do everything through Christ, who gives me strength 



Today's Thoughts:

Can we really do everything?

The power we receive in union with Christ is sufficient to do His will

And to face the challenges that arise from our commitment to doing it.



He does not grant us supper human ability to accomplish anything we

can imagine without regards for His interests. As we contend for the faith,

we will face troubles-pressures-and trials-as they come as Christ to

strengthen you. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, grant me the strength to face the challenges of

Today-Grant me the grace that some soul may learn the way of life

From me, that together may rejoice with You in all eternity. Help me

To witness among my relatives and friends. Amen.



I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.

Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: So humble yourselves before God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from you. 8 Come close to God, and God will come close to you. Wash your hands, you sinners; purify your hearts, for your loyalty is divided between God and the world
reflection: How can we draw near to God?-James gives five ways: (1) "Humble yourself before God"-(4:7) Yield to His authority and willcommit your life to Him and His control-And be willing to follow Him. (2) "Resist the Devil"-(4:7) Don't allow Satan to entice and tempt you. (3) "Wash your hands. and Purify your hearts"-that is lead a pure life-(4:8) Be cleansed from sin, replace your desire to sin with your desire to experience God's purity. (4) "Let there be sorrow and deep grief for your sins"-(4:9) Don't be afraid to express your deep heartfelt sorrow for what you have done. (5) "Bow down before the Lord and He will lift you up"-(4:10; I Peter 5:6) Bowing before the Lord means recognizing that your worth comes from God alone. Even though we do not deserve God's favor, He wants to lift us up and give us worth and dignity, despite our human shortcomings. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, give me the will to humbly draw close to You, replace my desire to sin that I might experience Your purity. Amen
original_content:
Today's Verses: James 4:7-8 (NLT)

So humble yourselves before God. Resist the devil, and he will flee from
you.

8 Come close to God, and God will come close to you. Wash your hands, you
sinners; 

purify your hearts, for your loyalty is divided between God and the world 



Today's Thoughts:

How can we draw near to God?-James gives five ways:

(1) "Humble yourself before God"-(4:7) Yield to His authority and willcommit your life to Him and His control-And be willing to follow Him.

(2) "Resist the Devil"-(4:7) Don't allow Satan to entice and tempt you.

(3) "Wash your hands. and Purify your hearts"-that is lead a pure
life-(4:8)

Be cleansed from sin, replace your desire to sin with your desire to
experience God's purity.

(4) "Let there be sorrow and deep grief for your sins"-(4:9) Don't be
afraid to express your deep 

heartfelt sorrow for what you have done. .

(5) "Bow down before the Lord and He will lift you up"-(4:10; I Pet. 5:6)
Bowing before the Lord

means recognizing that your worth comes from God alone. Even though we do
not deserve God's

favor, He wants to lift us up and give us worth and dignity, despite our
human shortcomings. .



Today's Suggested Prayer:

Dear Heavenly Father, give me the will to humbly draw close to You,

replace my desire to sin that I might experience Your purity. .Amen



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: " Oh, the joys of those who do not follow the advice of the wicked, or stand around with sinners, or join in with mockers." (Psalm 1:1)
reflection: When picking our friends or associates we need to be care as to what road they may take us down-because they can have a profound influence on us, often in subtle ways. If we chose friendship with those who mock what God considers important, we might sin by becoming indifferent to God's will. This kind of attitude is the same as mocking-we need to make a close examination of the life of our friends, do they build up our faith-or do they tear it down. True friends should help us draw closer to God, not hinder. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, grant me the wisdom to chose my friends wisely. Help me to stay on the path that leads to eternal life. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 1:1 (NLT)

" Oh, the joys of those who do not follow the advice of the wicked, 

or stand around with sinners, or join in with mockers." 



Today's Thoughts:

When picking our friends or associates we need to be care as to what road

they may take us down-because they can have a profound influence on us,

often in subtle ways. .



If we chose friendship with those who mock what God considers important,

we might sin by becoming indifferent to God's will. This kind of attitude is

the same as mocking-we need to make a close examination of the life of

our friends, do they build up our faith-or do they tear it down. .



True friends should help us draw closer to God, not hinder. .



Today's Suggested Prayer:

Dear Heavenly Father, grant me the wisdom to chose my friends wisely.

Help me to stay on the path that leads to eternal life. Amen.



"Fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom." Pro. 1:7

Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: They are like trees planted along the riverbank, bearing fruit each season. Their leaves never wither, and they prosper in all they do. (Psalm 1:3)
reflection: When the Scripture says, "In all they do, they prosper. " It does not mean Immunity to failure or difficulties. Nor is it a guarantee of health, wealth, Or happiness. What the Bible means by prosperity is this: when we apply God's wisdom, the fruit we bear will be good, and will meet with God's approval. Just as a tree soaks up water and bears luscious fruit, we are also to soak up God's Word, producing actions and attitudes that honor God. To achieve anything worthwhile, we must have God's word, in our hearts. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my spiritual roots would grow deep into Your Word and produce fruit that is pleasing to You. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verse: Psalm 1:3 (NLT) (those who do the Lord's will)

They are like trees planted along the riverbank, bearing fruit each season. 

Their leaves never wither, and they prosper in all they do. 



Today's Thoughts:

When the Scripture says, "In all they do, they prosper." It does not mean 

Immunity to failure or difficulties. Nor is it a guarantee of health,
wealth,

Or happiness. .



What the Bible means by prosperity is this: when we apply God's wisdom, 

the fruit we bear will be good, and will meet with God's approval. Just as 

a tree soaks up water and bears luscious fruit, we are also to soak up God's


Word, producing actions and attitudes that honor God. .



To achieve anything worthwhile, we must have God's word, in our hearts. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my spiritual roots would grow deep

into Your Word and produce fruit that is pleasing to You. Amen.



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 4 But not the wicked! They are like worthless chaff, scattered by the wind. 5 They will be condemned at the time of judgment. Sinners will have no place among the godly. 6 For the Lord watches over the path of the godly, but the path of the wicked leads to destruction. (Psalm 1:4-6)
reflection: God does not judge people on the basis of race, sex, or national origin. He judges them on the basis of their faith in Him and their response to His revealed will. Those who diligently try to obey God's will are blessed. They are like healthy, fruit-bearing trees planted along a river bank with strong roots (Jeremiah 17:7, 8), and God promises to watch over them. God's wisdom will guide their lives. In contrast, those who do not trust and obey Him have meaningless lives that blow away like dust. So be sure to choose God's path, because the path you choose determines how you spend eternity. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, it is my sincere prayer that Your will be ever clear to me, that I may not stray from Your path and loose Your eternal blessing. Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Ps. 1:4-6

4 But not the wicked! They are like worthless chaff, scattered by the wind.

5 They will be condemned at the time of judgment. Sinners will have no place
among the godly.

6 For the Lord watches over the path of the godly, but the path of the
wicked leads to destruction. 



Today's Thoughts:

God does not judge people on the basis of race, sex, or national origin.

He judges them on the basis of their faith in Him and their response to 

His revealed will. Those who diligently try to obey God's will are blessed. 

They are like healthy, fruit-bearing trees planted along a river bank with

strong roots (Jer. 17:7,8), and God promises to watch over them. .



God's wisdom will guide their lives. In contrast, those who do not trust 

and obey Him have meaningless lives that blow away like dust. So be

sure to choose God's path, because the path you choose determines how

you spend eternity. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Heavenly Father, it is my sincere prayer that Your will be ever clear

to me, that I may not stray from Your path and loose Your eternal blessing.
. Amen.



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

"I am the way and the truth and the life.

No one comes to the Father except through me." John 14:6

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 1 Why are the nations so angry? Why do they waste their time with futile plans? 2 The kings of the earth prepare for battle; the rulers plot together against the Lord and against his anointed one. (Psalm 2:1-2)
reflection: As you read the Psalm you will notice many verses give a prophetic description of Jesusthe Messiah (Christ) these verses are called messianic-His life-death-resurrection and future reign. We think of David as being the Author of many of the chapters of the Psalm, but we also know that he was a shepherd, soldier, and king. Something we may forget is that in Acts 2:29-30 is that he was also a prophet and of course this Psalm also describes the rebellion of the nations and the coming the coming of Christ to establish His reign. What we should learn from these Scriptures as well as others is that when a nation or nations ignore God's will and or His laws they will never win out in the end. I believe that our nation had better reexamine the laws they are passing-are they pleasing to God?
prayer: Dear Lord, as you know our nation and many others have strayed from even You ten simple laws-(the Ten Commandments). May we as Christians to always hold up in prayer our country's leaders. May they receive Godly wisdom from You. Amen.

plans?

2 The kings of the earth prepare for battle; the rulers plot together

Today's Thoughts:

As you read the Psalm you will notice many verses give a prophetic
description of Jesusthe Messiah (Christ) these verses are called messianic-His
life-death-resurrection and future reign.



We think of David as being the Author of many of the chapters of the Psalm,
but we also know that

he was a shepherd, soldier, and king. Something we may forget is that in
Acts 2:29-30 is that he was

also a prophet and of course this Psalm also describes the rebellion of the
nations and the coming the

coming of Christ to establish His reign. 



What we should learn from these Scriptures as well as others is that when a

God's will and or His laws they will never win out in the end. I believe
that our nation had better

reexamine the laws they are passing-are they pleasing to God?

Today's Prayer Suggestion: 

Dear Lord, as you know our nation and many others have strayed from even You


ten simple laws-(the Ten Commandments). May we as Christians to always hold

up in prayer our country's leaders. May they receive Godly wisdom from You.
. Amen. 





Pastor Al & Marcie Sather

Phil. 4:8 "Fix your thoughts on what is true and honorable and right."

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Why are the nations so angry? Why do they waste their time with futile plans? 2 The kings of the earth prepare for battle; the rulers plot together against the Lord and against his anointed one. 3 "Let us break their chains, " they cry, "and free ourselves from slavery to God. " 4 But the one who rules in heaven laughs. The Lord scoffs at them. (Psalm 2:1-4)
reflection: Yes God laughs, not at the nations, but at their confused thoughts about power. I guess you could say it is like the laughter of a father when his three or four year-old boasts that he or she can out run him or beat him in a wrestling match. The father knows the boundaries of power of his little childAnd so God knows the boundaries of power of the nations-every nation is limitedBut God is superior-supreme-His power has no limits. If you have to choose between confidence in God and confidence in any nationchoose God. Remember that the power of the tyrants of this world are limited by what God allows them. .
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father protect our nation from a sense of false power. Our country has lapsed into a false sense of power because of past victories, but as we should realize all power comes from You and so Lord we are at Your Mercy-So we pray be merciful to us and may Your Spirit once again be permitted to direct our nation in the way You so will. Amen.

boasts that he or she can out run him or beat him in a wrestling match. The

victories, but as we should realize all power comes from You and so

Lord we are at Your Mercy-So we pray be merciful to us and may 

Your Spirit once again be permitted to direct our nation in the way 

You so will. Amen. 



Pastor Alvin and Marcie Sather

Worship the LORD with gladness; 
come before him with joyful songs. Psalm 100:2

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: 10 Now then, you kings, act wisely! Be warned, you rulers of the earth!11 Serve the Lord with reverent fear, and rejoice with trembling. 12 Submit to God's royal son, or he will become angry, and you will be destroyed in the midst of all your activities - for his anger flares up in an instant. But what joy for all who take refuge in him! (Psalm 2:10-12)
reflection: We must surrender fully and submit to the Son. Christ is not only God's chosen King, He is also the rightful King of our hearts and lives to be ready for His coming, we must submit to His leadership every day.
prayer: Dear Lord-"Take my heart and let it be, consecrated Lord to Thee". Amen.
original_content:
Today's Verses: Psalm 2:10-12 

10 Now then, you kings, act wisely! Be warned, you rulers of the earth!11
Serve the Lord with reverent fear, and rejoice with trembling.

12 Submit to God's royal son, or he will become angry, and you will be
destroyed in the midst of all your activities- for his anger flares 

up in an instant. But what joy for all who take refuge in him! 



Today's Thoughts:

We must surrender fully and submit to the Son.

Christ is not only God's chosen King, He is also

the rightful King of our hearts and livesTo be ready for His coming, we must submit to

His leadership every day. .



Today's Prayer Suggestion:

Dear Lord-"Take my heart and let it be, consecrated Lord to Thee". Amen.



Pastor AL & Marcie Sather

I Cor. 3:20 The Lord knows the thoughts of the wise, that they are
worthless.
